title: Mandarin Chicken (Stir-Fried Chicken with Almonds)
ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable or peanut oil; plus additional oil for deep-frying
2 whole chicken breasts, skinned, boned and cut into 1-inch cubs
2 stalks of celery cut into ¼-inch slices
1 cup drained tinned sliced water chestnuts
1 cup drained tinned sliced bamboo shoots
instructions: In a small skillet cook the almonds in 2 tablespoons of the oil over moderately high heat, stirring, for 1 minute, or until they are golden, and then transfer them to paper towels to drain.
In a bowl combine the cornstarch and the egg white, add the chicken, tossing it to coat it with the mixture, and let the mixture stand for 10 minutes.

In a wok heat 2-inches of the oil to 375° F. and in it fry the chicken in batches, stirring gently, for 30 seconds, transferring it with a skimmer as it is fried to paper towels to drain.  Pour off the oil and wipe out the wok with paper towels.

In a bowl combine the oyster sauce, the Sherry, and the sugar.  Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the wok, heat it over high heat until it is hot, and in it stir-fry the celery for 30 seconds.  Add the water chestnuts and the bamboo shoots and stir-fry the mixture for 30 seconds.  Add the chicken pieces, the oyster sauce mixture and ½-cup water, and cook the mixture for 45 seconds.  Stir in the scallions, transfer the mixture to a heated serving dish, and sprinkle the top with the almonds.
Source:  You Asked For It, Gourmet Magazine, September 1982.
